qas.question: What was the catalyst that created greater interest in renewable resources?
There is criticism that the energy policies are expensive quick fixes that ignore which facts?
Who backed policies that have solutions that sound good but have poor prospects?

plausible_answers.text: renewable energy, nuclear power and domestic fossil fuels

qas.question: What kinds of energy did single-shot solutions create interest in?

plausible_answers.text: have been dominated by crisis-mentality thinking, promoting expensive quick fixes and single-shot solutions that ignore market and technology realities

qas.question: How have American entrepreneurships been criticized since the crisis?

plausible_answers.text: policies which promise solutions that are politically expedient, but whose prospects are doubtful

qas.question: What policies have been promoted due to nuclear power?
What are the results of policies that use renewable energy?

plausible_answers.text: expensive quick fixes and single-shot solutions

qas.question: What have politically correct policies about nuclear power promoted in America?
